{{Use British English|date=July 2013}} {{Use dmy dates|date=July 2013}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Todd Kane | image = Todd Kane.jpg | image_size = 200 | caption = | fullname = Todd Arthur Lucien Kane<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.premierleague.com/content/dam/premierleague/site-content/News/publications/squad-lists/Squad-Lists-September-2012.pdf|title=Premier League Clubs submit Squad Lists|date=5 December 2012|publisher=Premier League}}</ref> | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1993|9|17|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Huntingdon]], England | height = {{height|m=1.80}}<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nottinghamforest.co.uk/team/player-profile/todd-kane/17|title=Todd Kane profile summary|date=17 January 2015|publisher=Nottingham Forest F.C.}}</ref> | currentclub = [[Hull City A.F.C.| Hull City]] (on loan from [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]]) | clubnumber = 17 | position = [[Defender (association football)|Right back]] | youthyears1 = 2001–2011 | youthclubs1 = [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] | years1 = 2011– | clubs1 = [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] | caps1 = 0 | goals1 = 0 | years2 = 2012–2013 | clubs2 = → [[Preston North End F.C.|Preston North End]] (loan) | caps2 = 5 | goals2 = 0 | years3 = 2013–2014 | clubs3 = → [[Blackburn Rovers F.C.|Blackburn Rovers]] (loan) | caps3 = 41 | goals3 = 2 | years4 = 2014–2015 | clubs4 = → [[Bristol City F.C.|Bristol City]] (loan) | caps4 = 5 | goals4 = 0 | years5 = 2015 | clubs5 = → [[Nottingham Forest F.C.|Nottingham Forest]] (loan) | caps5 = 8 | goals5 = 1 | years6 = 2015–2016 | clubs6 = → [[N.E.C. (football club)|NEC Nijmegen]] (loan) | caps6 = 31 | goals6 = 1 | years7 = 2017–2018 | clubs7 = → [[FC Groningen|Groningen]] (loan) | caps7 = 11 | goals7 = 0 | years8 = 2018 | clubs8 = → [[Oxford United F.C.|Oxford United]] (loan) | caps8 = 17 | goals8 = 3 | years9 = 2018– | clubs9 = → [[Hull City A.F.C. | Hull City]] (loan) | caps9 = 31 | goals9 = 1 | nationalyears1 = 2011–2012 | nationalteam1 = [[England national under-19 football team|England U19]] | nationalcaps1 = 8 | nationalgoals1 = 1 | club-update = 19:35, 2 March 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = }}
'''Todd Arthur Lucien Kane''' (born 17 September 1993) is an English [[Association football|footballer]] who plays for [[Hull City A.F.C.| Hull City]] on loan from [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]], as a [[Defender (association football)|right back]], but can also play at right wing back, right midfielder or left back.
==Career==
===Chelsea=== Kane joined [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] at under-8 level and progressed through the youth system at the club.<ref name="Chelsea profile">{{cite web | url=http://www.chelseafc.com/chelsea-article/article/908966/title/todd-kane | publisher=Chelsea F.C | title=Chelsea Profile | accessdate=5 December 2012 | deadurl=yes | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121001004954/http://www.chelseafc.com/chelsea-article/article/908966/title/todd-kane | archivedate=1 October 2012 | df=dmy-all }}</ref> He signed his first professional contract with the club in July 2011.<ref>{{cite web| url=http://thechels.net/2011/07/blues-sign-four-to-pro-deals/| publisher=The Chels | title=Blues Sign Four To Pro Deals|accessdate=5 December 2012}}</ref> He was a part of the side that won the [[2011–12 FA Youth Cup]], beating [[Blackburn Rovers F.C.|Blackburn Rovers]] in the final.<ref name="Chelsea profile"/>
On 3 August 2015, Kane signed a new three-year deal at Chelsea, therefore keeping him at the club until 2018.<ref>{{Cite news |title=Signed a new 3 year contract for Chelsea football club today. The club I have supported my whole life and grew up playing for from the age of 7. Can't be more happier |url=https://instagram.com/p/57FP5Xsn7j/ |publisher=Todd Kane (Instagram) |date=3 August 2015}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |title=New deal for Kane |url=https://www.chelseafc.com/news/latest-news/2015/08/new-deal-for-kane.html |publisher=Chelsea F.C. |date=3 August 2015}}</ref> On 23 September 2016, Kane signed another new three-year, extending his stay until 2019.<ref>{{Cite news |title=New deal for Kane |url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news/latest-news/2016/09/new-deal-for-kane.html |publisher=Chelsea F.C. |date=23 September 2016 |accessdate=23 September 2016}}</ref>
====Loan to Preston North End==== In November 2012, he joined [[Football League One]] side [[Preston North End F.C.|Preston North End]] on loan until January 2013.<ref>{{cite web| url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/20451239| publisher=BBC Sport | title=Todd Kane: Chelsea loan defender to Preston North End|accessdate=5 December 2012}}</ref> He made his professional debut on 24 November 2012, in a 2–0 defeat to [[Leyton Orient F.C.|Leyton Orient]].<ref>{{cite web| url=http://www.elite.gd/news/todd-kane-makes-league-debut/| publisher=EMA| title=Todd Makes League Debut| accessdate=5 December 2012}}{{Dead link|date=July 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=no }}</ref> He made a total of five appearances in all competitions during his time at [[Deepdale]].
====Loans to Blackburn Rovers==== On 9 January 2013, he signed for [[Blackburn Rovers F.C.|Blackburn Rovers]] on a one-month loan deal.<ref>{{cite web| url=http://www.rovers.co.uk/news/article/kane-capture-completed-587886.aspx/| publisher=Blackburn Rovers F.C. | title=Rovers complete Kane capture|accessdate=9 January 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/3035471/title/kane-starts-loan-spell-at-blackburn | archive-url=https://archive.is/20130215174502/http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/3035471/title/kane-starts-loan-spell-at-blackburn | dead-url=yes | archivedate=15 February 2013 | publisher=Chelsea F.C. | title=Kane Starts Loan Spell at Blackburn | accessdate=9 January 2013 }}</ref> He made his debut for Rovers on 11 January in a 1–1 draw against [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]].<ref>{{cite web| url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/20907515 | publisher=BBC Sport | title=Wolves 1 : 1 Blackburn |accessdate=11 January 2013}}</ref> On 15 March 2013, Blackburn re-signed Kane on another month-long loan deal.<ref>{{cite web| url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11676/8568635/| publisher=Sky Sports | title=Blackburn have re-signed Chelsea defender Todd Kane on loan|accessdate=15 March 2013}}</ref> Kane later extended his contract with Blackburn until the end of the 2012–13 season.<ref>{{cite web| url=http://bleacherreport.com/tb/daaP1| publisher=Sky Sports| title=Chelsea defender Todd Kane extends Blackburn loan until end of season|accessdate=17 April 2013}}</ref> On 25 April 2013, Kane signed a new contract with Chelsea which keeps him at the club until 2016.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/3156350/title/new-deal-for-defender-kane | publisher=Chelsea F.C. | title=New Deal for Defender Kane | accessdate=25 April 2013 | deadurl=yes | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130529013548/http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/3156350/title/new-deal-for-defender-kane | archivedate=29 May 2013 | df=dmy-all }}</ref>
On 25 June 2013, Kane rejoined [[Blackburn Rovers F.C.|Blackburn Rovers]] on loan for the entire [[2013–14 Blackburn Rovers F.C. season|2013–14 Football League Championship]] season.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.rovers.co.uk/news/article/chelsea-starlet-set-to-sign-878659.aspx| publisher=Blackburn Rovers F.C. |title=Chelsea Starlet Set To Sign|accessdate=25 April 2013}}</ref> He scored his first professional goal against [[Barnsley F.C.|Barnsley]] on 24 August 2013 in a 5–2 win.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/23736833| publisher=BBC Sport |title=Blackburn 5 Barnsley 2|accessdate=24 August 2013}}</ref> He scored his second goal for Blackburn in their 4–2 victory over [[Birmingham City F.C.|Birmingham]] which turned out to be his last game for Blackburn.
====Loan to Bristol City==== On 14 November 2014, [[Bristol City F.C.|Bristol City]] signed Todd on a two-month loan until 18 January 2015.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://weaintgotnohistory.sbnation.com/2014/11/15/7225211/todd-kane-joins-bristol-city-on-two-month-loan |title=Todd Kane joins Bristol City on two-month loan|accessdate=16 November 2014}}</ref> On 15 November 2014, Todd made his debut for Bristol City as a substitute for Scott Wagstaff in the 75th minute against Swindon Town, the game ended in a 1–0 loss for Bristol City. On 7 December Todd made his first start for Bristol City against [[A.F.C. Telford United|Telford United]] in the second round proper of the FA Cup, where Todd played the full 90 minutes; the game ended in a 1–0 win for Bristol City. In the dying minutes, Todd suffered a shoulder injury from Godfrey Poku.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.com/gamecast/409703/gamecast.html|title= Bristol City 1–0 Telford United|accessdate=7 December 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bcfc.co.uk/news/article/kane-injury-not-as-bad-as-first-feared-2133568.aspx|title=Kane injury not as bad as first feared|accessdate=7 December 2014}}</ref>
====Loan to Nottingham Forest==== After his loan spell at Bristol City expired, Kane was loaned to Championship club [[Nottingham Forest F.C.|Nottingham Forest]] until the end of the 2014–15 season.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.nottinghamforest.co.uk/news/article/forest-bring-in-chelsea-defender-2188440.aspx |title=Chelsea defender signs |publisher=Nottingham Forest F.C. |date=8 January 2015 |accessdate=1 February 2018}}</ref> Kane made his debut for Nottingham Forest on 10 January 2015 against [[Sheffield Wednesday F.C.|Sheffield Wednesday]], which ended in a 2–0 loss for Forest.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2015/01/10/england/championship/nottingham-forest-fc/sheffield-wednesday-fc/1705247/ |title=Nottingham Forest vs. Sheffield Wednesday 0–2 |date=10 January 2015 |publisher=Soccerway |accessdate=1 February 2018}}</ref> After his debut, Kane made three consecutive start under the management of [[Stuart Pearce]] including a 2–1 away win against [[Derby County]].<ref name="soccerway">{{Soccerway|todd-kane/245833}}</ref>
After [[Dougie Freedman]] replaced Stuart Pearce Kane's role in the squad was reduced greatly, only making the bench twice and ending up as an unused substitute for both games.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/dougie-freedman-new-nottingham-forest-5087620 |title=Dougie Freedman named new manager of Nottingham Forest replacing Stuart Pearce |newspaper=Daily Mirror |first=Alex |last=Richards |date=1 February 2015 |accessdate=1 February 2018}}</ref> On 7 March 2015 Kane returned to the starting line-up in the match against [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]]; the match ended in a 2–1 win for Forest.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2015/03/07/england/championship/nottingham-forest-fc/middlesbrough-football-club/1705507/|title=Nottingham 2–1 Middlesbrough |publisher=Soccerway |accessdate=7 March 2015}}</ref> On 6 April 2015, Kane came off the bench replacing fellow goal-scorer, [[Tyler Walker (footballer)|Tyler Walker]], in the 75th minute against [[Brentford F.C.|Brentford]]. In just two minutes after coming off the bench, Kane scored from a cross Ben Osborn to the far post; though the two-goal lead was not enough for a win as Forest drew 2–2.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-3027626/Brentford-2-2-Nottingham-Forest-Bees-earn-late-point-maintain-Premier-League-promotion-push.html|title=Brentford 2–2 Nottingham Forest: Jota earns The Bees a late point after Tyler Walker fires visitors ahead |newspaper=Daily Mail |first=James |last=Andrew |date=6 April 2015 |accessdate=1 February 2018}}</ref>
====Loan to NEC Nijmegen==== On 6 August 2015, Kane joined [[N.E.C. (football club)|NEC Nijmegen]] on a season-long loan to gain first team experience abroad.<ref>{{Cite news |title=Dutch loan for Kane |url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news/latest-news/2015/08/dutch-loan-for-kane.html |publisher=Chelsea F.C. |date=6 August 2015}}</ref> On 12 August, Kane made his debut coming off the bench in a match against [[S.B.V. Excelsior|Excelsior]] which ended in a 1–0 win for NEC Nijmegen.<ref>{{Cite news |title=NEC vs. Excelsior 1 – 0 |url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2015/08/12/netherlands/eredivisie/nijmegen-eendracht-combinatie/sbv-excelsior/2039256/ |publisher=Soccerway |date=12 August 2015}}</ref> On 23 August, Kane made his first start in a 2–0 loss against [[AFC Ajax|Ajax]].<ref>{{Cite news |title=NEC vs. Ajax 0 – 2 |url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2015/08/23/netherlands/eredivisie/nijmegen-eendracht-combinatie/afc-ajax/2039271// |publisher=Soccerway |date=23 August 2015}}</ref> Kane scored his first and only goal of the season in a 3–1 loss against [[FC Utrecht]] on April 10, 2016.<ref>{{Cite news |title=Utrecht vs. NEC 3 - 1 |url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2016/04/10/netherlands/eredivisie/stichting-fc-utrecht/nijmegen-eendracht-combinatie/2039517/ |publisher=Soccerway |date=10 April 2016}}</ref>
Kane's season was cut short when he suffered an injury during the game against [[PEC Zwolle]] on April 20, 2016. Kane was stretched off the pitch in the closing stages of the game. After an MRI scan, it was confirmed that Kane had torn his anterior cruciate ligament, ruling him out for 4–6 months.<ref>{{Cite news |title=Chelsea Loanee Todd Kane tears cruciate ligament |url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/1862/premier-league/2016/04/22/22681732/chelsea-loanee-todd-kane-tears-cruciate-ligament/ |publisher=Goal|date=22 April 2016}}</ref>
====Loan to Groningen==== On 5 July 2017, following his recovery from a knee injury, Kane returned to the Netherlands to join [[FC Groningen]] on a season-long loan.<ref>{{Cite news |title=Kane crosses the North Sea |url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news/latest-news/2017/07/kane-crosses-the-north-sea.html |publisher=Chelsea F.C. |date=5 July 2017 |accessdate=5 July 2017}}</ref> On the opening day of the season, he made his debut during Groningen's 3–3 draw with [[SC Heerenveen|Heerenveen]], replacing [[Mike te Wierik]] in the 83rd minute.<ref>{{Cite news |title=Groningen vs. Heerenveen |url=https://uk.soccerway.com/matches/2017/08/13/netherlands/eredivisie/stichting-fc-groningen/sportclub-heerenveen/2462346/ |publisher=Soccerway |date=13 August 2017 |accessdate=30 January 2018}}</ref> Two weeks later, Kane made his first start for Groningen during their 2–1 home victory over [[FC Utrecht|Utrecht]].<ref>{{Cite news |title=Groningen vs. Utrecht |url=https://uk.soccerway.com/matches/2017/08/27/netherlands/eredivisie/stichting-fc-groningen/stichting-fc-utrecht/2462364/ |publisher=Soccerway |date=27 August 2017 |accessdate=30 January 2018}}</ref> On 30 January 2018, after only appearing in twelve games all season, Kane's loan spell with Groningen was terminated.<ref>{{Cite news |title=Todd Kane returned to Chelsea |url=https://www.fcgroningen.nl/nieuws/todd-kane-terug-naar-chelsea/2 |publisher=Groningen F.C. |language=Dutch |date=30 January 2018 |accessdate=30 January 2018}}</ref>
====Loan to Oxford United==== On 31 January 2018 Kane joined [[Oxford United F.C.|Oxford United]] on loan for the remainder of the season.<ref>{{cite web|title=Oxford United sign Chelsea defender Todd Kane on deadline day|url=http://www.oxfordmail.co.uk/sport/15909998.Oxford_United_sign_Chelsea_defender_Todd_Kane_on_deadline_day/|newspaper=[[Oxford Mail]]|date=31 January 2018|accessdate=31 January 2018|first=David|last=Pritchard}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Todd Kane: Chelsea right-back joins Oxford United on loan|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/42890810|publisher=BBC Sport |date=31 January 2018|accessdate=31 January 2018}}</ref>
====Loan to Hull City==== On 17 July 2018, Kane joined [[Hull City A.F.C.|Hull City]] on a season-long loan.<ref>{{cite web|title=Todd Kane: Hull City sign Chelsea defender on season-long loan|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44860609|publisher=BBC Sport |date=17 July 2018|accessdate=17 July 2018}}</ref> He made his debut in the first match of the 2018–19 season on 6 August 2018 at home to [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]] in a 1–3 defeat.<ref>{{cite news | url = https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45001925 | title = Hull City v Aston Villa | date = 6 August 2018 | work = BBC Sport | publisher = BBC | accessdate = 6 August 2018}}</ref>
==International career== Kane was first called up by [[England National Football Team|England]] to represent [[England national under-19 football team|the U19s]] at a friendly tournament in Limoges during October 2011. On 8 August 2013, he was called up to [[England national under-21 football team|England U21]] squad for the first time for a friendly match against [[Scotland national under-21 football team|Scotland]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.thefa.com/england/mens-under-21s/News/2013/scotland-squad-announced-080813.aspx| publisher=thefa.com |title=Roy Hodgson names a 25-man squad for game with Scotland at Bramall Lane |accessdate=8 August 2013}}</ref>

(football club)|NEC Nijmegen]] (loan) |[[2015–16 Eredivisie|2015–16]] |[[Eredivisie]] |31||1||3||0||colspan="2"|—||colspan="2"|—||34||1 |- |rowspan="1" valign="center"|[[FC Groningen|Groningen]] (loan) |[[2017–18 Eredivisie|2017–18]] |Eredivisie |11||0||1||0||colspan="2"|—||colspan="2"|—||12||0 |- |rowspan="1" valign="center"|[[Oxford United F.C.|Oxford United]] (loan) |[[2017–18 Oxford United F.C. season|2017–18]] |League One |15||2||colspan="2"|—||colspan="2"|—||colspan="2"|—||15||2 |- |rowspan="1" valign="center"|[[Hull City A.F.C.|Hull City]] (loan) |[[2018–19 Hull City A.F.C. season|2018–19]] |Championship |31||1||1||0||1||0||colspan="2"|—||33||1 |- !colspan=3|Career total||145||7||9||0||2||0||0||0||156||7 |}
==Honours==
